p: The WNV has only been reported in semen or to be transmitted sexually in isolated case reports. Likewise, only a single autopsy report suggests the possibility of WNV-induced orchitis. Influenza, a respiratory pathogen, has not been found in semen or been shown to be sexually transmissible. Research demonstrating its impact on fertility has focused on the effects of febrile illness on semen parameters, showing that febrile episodes are linked to transiently decreased sperm count, motility, and morphology.
